Europe's legend of the Unicorn probably came from Greek mythology. ... when 
the Greek God, Zeus, became very ill and was nursed back to health by a she-
goat named Amalthea. In the tale, Zeus broke off one of Amalthea's horns and out 
spilled an unlimited amount of food. This later became known as the 'Horn of 
Plenty".
